String.Name: Drop your module.json here to install a new plugin.
Plugin: {name} installed! Restart your HunterPie to load the plugin!
This plugin does not support auto-update. You will need to manually download its files.
HunterPie version is incompatible with this plugin.
Plugin initialization failed. It will not be loaded until HunterPie restart.
Are you sure you want to exit HunterPie?
Monster Hunter World Path not found
You haven't added the game path yet. Do you want to do it now?
Do you want to upload your current character build to Honey Hunters World?
HunterPie is now in offline mode.
Auto-Update is disabled. If your HunterPie has any issues or doesn't support the current game version, try enabling auto-update.
Detected game version ({GAME_VERSION}) not mapped. Either your game is outdated or the current version is not supported yet.
Failed to launch Monster Hunter World.
Failed to update HunterPie. Check if you're connected to the internet.
If enabled, HunterPie will look for new updates on startup.
Minimize HunterPie after launching the game
If enabled, HunterPie will be automatically minimized after launching the game.
If enabled, HunterPie will hide in your system tray and run on background when it's minimized.
If enabled, HunterPie Native features will be available.
If enabled, HunterPie will hide in your system tray on startup.
Close HunterPie when game is closed
If enabled, HunterPie will automatically shutdown when the game is no longer running.
Choose the branch you want HunterPie to update from. BETA has the latest features while master is more stable.
Choose the language file you want HunterPie to use.
Choose the theme file you want HunterPie to use.
Select your Monster Hunter World executable path.
Arguments to be used when launching the game. Leave this empty if you don't know what you are doing.
If enabled, HunterPie will show your game activity on your Discord status.
If enabled, HunterPie will show the health percentage of the monster you're hunting.
Let people ask to join my online session
If enabled, people will be able to ask to join your Monster Hunter session.
If enabled, the overlay will be created and initialize. If this option is disabled, all widgets won't be initialized.
If enabled, the Overlay will be visible in-game.
Hide Overlay when game is unfocused.
If enabled, HunterPie overlay will be automatically hidden when the game loses focus. (e.g: When you Alt+Tab)

Enabling Hardware acceleration will make the overlay be rendered by the graphics card. Turning this off will change the rendering mode to software rendering, which will use more CPU. Turn this option off if you're having FPS issues.
Enabling Anti-Aliasing will make the edges of rendered components smoother, disabling this option might increase performance.
Changes all HunterPie animations framerate. Set this to a lower value if you're having FPS issues.

Delay between scans. Setting this to a really low value will make HunterPie scan for the game more often at cost of CPU. (E.g: Setting this to 200 will make HunterPie scan the game 5 times per second).
HotKey to hide overlay. Changing the HotKey requires restart for it to take effect.
Force DirectX 11 Fullscreen to be behind overlay
This option will force the game to always be behind HunterPie's overlay, as a result the overlay will appear even in DirectX 11 Fullscreen. REQUIRES FULLSCREEN OPTIMIZATIONS TO BE ENABLED.
If disabled, the monster widget won't be created at all.
If enabled, the monster widget will be visible whenever it has content to show.
Text format for the monster health bar.
This is part of the April fools day. Replaces all o's and u's with OwO's and UwU's
Text format for the monster ailment buildup.
Text format for the monster ailment timer.
Text format for the monster part health.
Use lockon instead of map pin to target monster
If enabled, HunterPie will use the in-game monster lockon to select your target.
If enabled, the Monster Bar will not display HP-related details (total and remaining health, stamina, the capturable icon and enrage status and timer).
Show all monsters but highlight my target
Show all but hide inactive monsters after 15 seconds
Show all until a monster is selected
Hotkey to change the monster bar mode. Changing the HotKey requires restart for it to take effect.
If enabled, the monster action name will be displayed.
If enabled, monster weaknesses will become visible under their health bar.
Hide inactive parts after a few seconds
If enabled, parts will be automatically hidden after some time without taking damage.
If enabled, parts will be sorted whenever the monster takes damage, prioritizing wounded parts and then most recent damaged parts
Show only parts that haven't been broken
If enabled, only parts that haven't been broken will be shown.
Show only parts that can be broken
If enabled, only parts that can be broken and have a break threshold will be visible.
Hide inactive ailments after a few seconds
If enabled, ailments will be automatically hidden after some time when inactive.
If enabled, severable, breakable and removable parts will be displayed under the monster bar.
If enabled, ailments bar will be colored based on their group.
If enabled, monster ailments will be displayed under the monster bar.
If enabled, monster flinch parts will be displayed under the monster bar.
Max number of parts per column
Sets the maximum number of different parts each column can have at once.
Sets the maximum number of columns of part/ailments bars.
Delay to wait before hiding parts after they get damaged or ailments when they become inactive.
If disabled, the player widget won't be created at all.
If enabled, the player widget will become visible whenever it has content.
If enabled, the player widget will enhance in-game one, without existing elements duplication.
The string that will appear on top of the health bar. (E.g: '{HR} | {MR} {Name}' will be rendered as 'Your HR' | 'Your MR' 'Your Name')
If enabled, the player widget will be hidden when you enter peace zones like Astera, Gathering Hub and your room.
If disabled, the harvest box widget won't be created.
If enabled, the Harvest Box Widget will become visible whenever it has content.
If enabled, the Steam tracker will be displayed on the bottom of the widget.
If enabled, the Argosy tracker will be displayed on the bottom of the widget.
If enabled, the Tailraiders tracker will be displayed on the bottom of the widget
If enabled, this widget will be displayed in every place, including expeditions, Guiding Lands and any other monster zones.
Changes the Harvest Box widget position.
If enabled, the Harvest Box Widget will use it's compact design.
If disabled, the damage widget will not be created.
If enabled, the Damage Meter Widget will be visible whenever it has content.
If enabled, the Damage Meter timer will be visible.
If enabled, the Damage Widget will show individual total damage.
If enabled, the Damage Widget will show individual damage per second.
If enabled, the timer will be visible in Expeditions/Guiding Lands.
If enabled, the Damage Widget will only show the timer, hiding the party members damage.
If enabled, only your damage will be visible.
Changes the Damage Meter widget position.
If enabled, damage plot will be visible.
Delay between plot updates when there are no damage updates. Lower the value - higher CPU cost. (E.g: Setting this to 200 will make HunterPie update the plot 5 times per second).
If enabled, the abnormalities bar will be alligned horizontally. Disable this option if you want a vertical abnormalities bar.
If enabled, the abnormalities will show their time left under their icon.
If enabled, abnormality names will be visible.
If disabled, the specialized tool widget will not be created.
If enabled, the primary specialized tool widget will be visible whenever it has content.
If enabled, the secondary specialized tool widget will be visible whenever it has content.
Changes the primary specialized tool widget position.
Changes the secondary specialized tool widget position.
If disabled, the class widget won't be initialized at all.
If enabled, the Greatsword helper will be visible whenever you equip a Greatsword.
If enabled, the Insect Glaive helper will be visible whenever you equip an Insect Glaive.
If enabled, the Charge Blade helper will be visible whenever you equip a Charge Blade.
If enabled, the Switch Axe helper will be visible whenever you equip a Switch Axe.
If enabled, the Hunting Horn helper will be visible whenever you equip a Hunting Horn.
If enabled, the Gun Lance helper will be visible whenever you equip a Gun Lance.
If enabled, the Longsword helper will be visible whenever you equip a Longsword.
If enabled, the Bow helper will be visible whenever you equip a Bow.
If enabled, the Hammer helper will be visible whenever you equip a Hammer.
If enabled, the Dual Blades helper will be visible whenever you equip Dual Blades.
If enabled, the Lance helper will be visible whenever you equip a Lance.
If enabled, the Heavy Bowgun helper will be visible whenever you equip a Heavy Bowgun.
If enabled, the Light Bowgun helper will be visible whenever you equip a Light Bowgun.

Attention: Class helpers are still in development and more classes will be supported in the future. Each class helper has it's own settings, so you can have different positions for this widget depending on the class. Use the Design Mode feature to scale and move this widget.
If enabled notifications will be shown
If disabled, the notifications widget won't be initialized at all.
Consider donating if you want to support HunterPie development!
Enables debug messages. Do not turn this option on if you have no idea what you're doing. This is part of the development tools.
Enables unknown monster statuses. Do not turn this option on if you have no idea what you're doing. This is part of the development tools.
If enabled, HunterPie will try to load the custom monster data file. Do not turn this option on if you have no idea what you're doing. This is part of the development tools.
If enabled, HunterPie will automatically send the crashes log to me. You can disable this option, however, keeping this enabled will help me spot and fix bugs faster.
Select your custom monster data file path.
Enabling streamer mode will make this widget visible for OBS and similar window capture softwares. Note that, enabling this will also make the window visible when you Alt+Tab.
{Username} wants to join your session. Do you want to accept?
Build uploaded to Honey Hunters World!
